title: @Riot: Weren't you introducing some early surrender tech (not /remake)?
body: For those 0/10 games within 8 minutes, we don't want to continue for another 12, and don't want to get Leaverbusted. Whatever happened to that Early Surrender you were working on (the one that can occur by 10 minutes, but requires 100% vote)?

replies.body: Unanimous surrender (5/5) at 15 minutes is the version we were looking to test. That slipped as a priority relative to the new client and pre-season work. We'll be getting back to it soonish most likely though. Probably going to start off with a test on one region only, then assess whether it's working as intended or not and whether we should roll it out wider.

That would be abused, unless the person who went AFK received a huge enough penalty as to make it really painful to leave a game (-100 LP or something). But then, people with connection problems would complain that there in bronze 5 because "rito servers crap".

Dota handles it and it's no problem. League can do the same.

People aren't going to be able to keep abusing it when they have to take leaverbusters.
Dota still counts games where one of your teammates abandons as a loss. The only purpose of the system is to waste less of your time, which I think is ideal.
In Dota 2 it still counts as lose. It only lets you leave without getting penalty for leaving.

Just do this - AFK player takes 75% of everyone's LP loss. Let's say everyone'd lose 20 LP - this way, the people who played lose 5 LP, while the player who left loses 80LP (20 his + 15 times 4). This way, you'd lose LP as if you lost a game, then won one with decent MMR, but you'd lose half the time.

If more than 1 player leaves, he also receives the 75% LP loss, but it isn't deducted from the others, or calculated for the guy who left with him. In that case 3 players lose 5 LP, while the 2 leavers lose 65LP (20 of theirs + 3 times 15LP). Obviously, the numbers would need adjustments for flex queue as there can be more than 2 people premade.

Games surrendered like these after losing the possibility of remake would then give the enemy team LP based on how much the leavers lost. In the first case, they'd get 60 LP divided onto 5 people, so 12LP. In the second case, they'd get 45 LP divided by 5 people, so 9LP each.

Or why not:
For every (full) minute someone is afk/dc, afk player takes 1 pt of LP loss from each teammate, max of 10/person.  So assuming the same 20LP game, a player that drops for 5 mins ends with -40 LP and all other players get -15 LP.  (maximum LP "protection" is 10 (or some other number) so if 2 players drop, remaining players still can lose -10 LP but the loss divides between dropped players, pro-rated)

As an aside, if player returns and the team WINS, then LP losses for drop player remain but are mitigated by win LP (if player is gone 5 mins, they have -20 LP for time out, but +20 LP for win, = 0 LP gain).  If player does not return before end of game, player gets +0 LP for win and full "missing player" penalty.  So a player gone for the final 10 mins of a game would get -40 LP if the team wins and -60 LP if the team loses.  This gives a player an incentive to return, but acknowledges that the team accomplished a lot without them.

(numbers tweaks could go either direction depending on how its received, ie. -1 LP loss/2 mins for remaining players instead of 1 LP/min if too penalizing for dc player, or max raised to 15 LP protection per player if wanting to be harsher to leaver)

When they look at something like that they have to consider possible abuses, such as teams harassing one person to afk so they can get out of a loss or taking turns doing it to minimize the penalty amongst a group. I'm not saying it's impossible, just that it's more complicated than it sounds.

Personally I think that the surrender function invites toxicity and would like to see it removed entirely, has this ever been discussed internally?

The very concept of it invites players to give up early when they make a single early mistake, regardless of which team is actually in a better position to win. More often than not this leads to flaming and other pointless typing in chat, which just makes the game harder to win.

 I will admit that in the top brackets of play the surrender function is working as intended, but the fact is that 99% of the community does not play there, and surrender is used more often than not in a super negative way.

I agree with this. While it's nice to be able to ultimately decide that a match is just not worth continuing, I have seen more times where people just give up completely because "it's almost 20 minutes." Giving up sucks.

My feelings exactly.

At no point does surrender benefit the player or the game.

Getting into a new match won't make you a better player. If you are losing lane and losing games often then you're going to keep doing so. Either you need to play out the game and learn what to do when behind, or you'll keep losing.

I have had people try to surrender at 20 because we were down by 1 kill and neither team had turrets. I have had people try to surrender because we lost a dragon, lost a baron, didn't get first tower, and the list goes on.

Then when I say no and that we can still win, they blow up at me.

The only time someone should surrender is if they aren't playing to have fun, improve, or gain elo, which begs the question, why are you playing? If you are playing the game then you play to win until your nexus explodes. Until that point you can turn it. The only time this isn't true is at challenger tier or extremely high level 5 man team play. In those situations players understand the intricacies of the game to the extent that they can see the game is absolutely impossible as the opposing players won't make mistakes that would give up their lead at that level. However, at any tier lower than that, it is highly possible for players to screw the pooch and make a game changing mistake.

This is why I want an auto decline function and for the surrender window to go away once you have voted instead of when everyone has voted.
